settings.text: View our most frequently asked questions about the PetSnowy

settings.h3: Does SNOW⁺ require special litter?
settings.text: SNOW⁺ operates efficiently with clumping litter. We advise using a premium, standard-weight, clay-based clumping litter. Additionally, you can use certain silica gel litter beads and crystals with SNOW⁺ as long as they can pass through the screen. Plant-based alternatives may also be compatible, but they often produce less compact clumps that might lead to moisture accumulation in the waste drawer. When opting for a plant-based litter with SNOW⁺, consider more frequent waste drawer emptying and cleaning. Litters that are not suitable for SNOW⁺ include those designed solely for absorption, non-clumping or those with loose clumping properties, newspaper-based options, and absorbent wood pellet litter.

settings.h3: How many cats can use SNOW⁺?
settings.text: We recommend having up to 4 indoor cats using a single SNOW⁺ unit; however, some of our customers have more cats and still use just one unit. Here's a general guideline: with one cat using SNOW⁺, you may need to empty the waste drawer every 2 weeks. For two cats, it might be once a week, and for three cats, twice a week, and so forth. SNOW⁺ features an expanded waste drawer for greater waste capacity, reducing the frequency of emptying. SNOW⁺ initiates a cleaning cycle 4 minutes after each use, but if another cat interrupts this period, the timer will reset for another 4 minutes, potentially leaving waste in the litter for more than 4 minutes. Having too many cats per SNOW⁺ unit may result in the litter not being completely clean for the next use.

settings.h3: Will my cat actually go inside the globe?
settings.text: Cats are naturally inquisitive and tend to explore new objects. If your cat is accustomed to a covered litter box, they might adapt more quickly to SNOW⁺. We recommend initially keeping SNOW⁺ turned off while your cat gets used to it. Place SNOW⁺ in the same spot as your old litter box. You can keep the old litter box nearby for a short period. Take a cup of litter from the old box and mix it with the clean litter in SNOW⁺. This will provide a familiar scent, encouraging your cat to investigate. Once your cat steps inside and feels the litter, they should instinctively know what to do. For further guidance on acclimating your cat (超链接到引导小猫使用专属页面）, please refer to our resources.

settings.h3: Can kittens use SNOW⁺ ?
settings.text: Kittens weighing 3.3 pounds or more can safely use SNOW⁺ in automatic mode. For kittens below this weight threshold, turn off automatic cleaning and opt for "semi-automatic" mode. To do this, deactivate automatic cleaning in the PetSnowy APP and manually initiate the cleaning process pressing the clean button or the App once or twice daily (ensure the kitten is not inside the machine when pressing the button). This approach ensures your kitten's safety during their early encounters with SNOW⁺, while also relieving you of the need to manually scoop the litter box.

settings.h3: What are the dimensions for the litter box?
settings.text:
Product name：SNOW+ Self Cleaning Litter Box
Size: 29.5'' in length, 20'' in width, and 25.6'' in height (75 x 50.8 x 65cm). 
Entryway, inclusive of the ramp: 14.9’’ in height and 9.05’’ in length (38 x 23cm). 
Internal capacity: 2.9ft3 or 83L. 
Waste drawer: 2.6 gallons or 10L. 
Globe: a capacity of 2ft3 with a diameter of 19.68'' (56L, 50 cm in diameter).

settings.h3: Does SNOW⁺ assist with cats that spray very high?
settings.text: Yes, SNOW⁺ is an excellent solution for cats that spray or have high-aiming habits. The design of the unit is well-suited to handle such situations. The globe is protected by a durable, impermeable flexible liner. If any liquid manages to reach above the halfway mark, it will simply drip or drain down to the liner and then into the litter, without collecting or pooling. This will result in a clump forming at the edge of the litter bed, which will be removed during the cleaning cycle when the globe liner peels off. If your cat consistently sprays, you may need to clean the interior of the globe more frequently to remove any residue. For a thorough cleaning, you can easily remove the entire globe. Our globe is designed with a magnetic attachment, making it a quick one-second process to take it out for cleaning.

settings.h3: Does SNOW⁺ have a weight limit?
settings.text: Literally saying, SNOW⁺ doesn't have a weight limit, but we recommend it for cats weighing less than 20 lbs (9 kg) for the best comfort of your feline friend.

settings.h3: What is the TiO2 deodorization system?
settings.text: The combination of a TiO2 system and UV light is commonly referred to as a photocatalyst. TiO2 is an initials for photocatalyst, a nano-scale semiconductor material that deodorizes and dissolves hazardous compounds in the air while remaining kitten-safe. UV light is used in conjunction with our TiO2 system to improve bacteria and virus deodorization and breakdown. The duel will begin only once the cat has left after using the toilet. The UV light is used to activate TiO2 and sterilize. It only works when cat leaves and is never directly exposed to the walkway, making it completely safe for the cat.

settings.h3: Does SNOW⁺ require special trash bags?
settings.text: The self-sealing feature is just one of the numerous advantages our device offers. While there are alternative options (such as diy bags), we suggest using our SNOW⁺ Waste Drawer Liners for optimal performance. These liners are engineered for use with the waste drawer and its self-sealing function, ensuring durability and strength to handle various types of cat waste.

settings.h3: How frequently should I empty the waste drawer?
settings.text: The frequency of emptying the waste drawer depends on the number and size of your cats. SNOW⁺ features an enlarged waste drawer, so you may only need to empty it once every two weeks for one cat, once a week for two cats, twice a week for three cats, and so forth.

settings.h3: Can SNOW⁺ help minimize litter tracking?
settings.text: Absolutely, SNOW⁺ comes with a litter mat that will be placed at the walkway of the litter box's entrance. With SNOW⁺'s unique entrance design and the assistance of the litter mat, it can significantly reduce most litter tracking issues. The litter mat is easily removable and easy to clean, or you can choose to pour the litter from the mat back into the globe for continued use.

settings.h3: How much litter should I add to SNOW⁺?
settings.text: Fill the globe with litter until it reaches the max fill line on the rubber globe liner when it's spread flat. This is approximately 10 pounds of clumping litter (4.8 kg), 5 pounds of tofu litter (2.4 kg) by weight, or 1 gallon (4L) by volume. Be cautious not to overfill the globe. Since the waste clumps are removed during each cycle, there's no need to use an excessive amount of litter in the globe.

settings.h3: How frequently should I refill litter in SNOW⁺?
settings.text: SNOW⁺ is highly efficient in its litter usage due to its patented sifting system, which only removes the clumps. We suggest verifying the litter level in comparison to the maximum fill line (found on the globe's rubber liner) each time you empty the waste drawer. This typically occurs about once every two weeks for a single cat or once a week for households with multiple cats. Ensure not to overfill the globe.

settings.h3: Is Pretty Litter compatible with SNOW⁺?
settings.text: Litter beads and crystals, as long as they are small enough to pass through the screen, like Pretty Litter, can be used with SNOW⁺. Nevertheless, we recommend utilizing a high-quality, clay-based clumping litter for optimal performance.

settings.h3: How long will a Robertet® fragrance box last?
settings.text: One Robertet® fragrance box（超链接到产品） is designed to last for 30 days. When it is depleted, the app will send a notification to switch fragrances.

settings.h3: Is it possible to use SNOW+ without the fragrance box?
settings.text: The Robertet® fragrance box（超链接到产品) we offer is specifically formulated to neutralize thiols and cyclohexylamine found in cat urine without generating any ozone. However, if you are sensitive to smells, you have the option to remove the fragrance. In fact, even if you choose to use it, the scent is barely noticeable unless you bring your nose close to the entrance. To remove the fragrance, simply detach the fragrance box from the deodorizer box cover.

settings.h3: Will the globe rotate while my cat is inside?
settings.text: No, the globe will remain stationary while your cat is inside. SNOW⁺ features SnowSafe⁺ technology, including a weight sensor, an anti-pinch system, and safety app notifications, which detect your cat each time they enter or re-enter the globe. This resets the countdown timer, ensuring that the cleaning cycle won't start for another 4 minutes.

settings.h3: Are there any rakes or wires inside the globe?
settings.text: No, there are no rakes or wires inside the globe that could potentially harm your cat. SNOW⁺ has been carefully designed with your cat's safety as a top priority.

settings.h3: What happens if my cat tries to enter the globe while it is rotating?
settings.text: SnowSafe⁺ technology will detect your cat, causing the globe to stop immediately. The cycle will not resume until 15 seconds after the cat is no longer detected. If your cat or another object continues to trigger the sensor, SNOW⁺ will not restart the cleaning cycle. Instead, a series of lights will flash, and the app will send notifications to indicate the issue. You can refer to the Instruction Manual for troubleshooting common problems, and our Customer Experience team is available to assist as needed.

settings.h3: If I have multiple cats, how do I know which cat is using the SNOW⁺?
settings.text: Inside the PetSnowy app, you have the option to set a unique Pet ID for each cat. SNOW+ will be able to distinguish between the cats by recording their weight readings.

settings.h3: What type of power supply does SNOW⁺ require? How much power does SNOW⁺ consume?
settings.text: SNOW⁺ is compatible with both 110V and 220V currents. Please use the included power supply with the unit. SNOW⁺ has a very low power consumption, using only 1.83 kWh per month.

settings.h3: How to clean SNOW⁺?
settings.text: Kindly refer to our video clips(点击播放清洗视频） for cleaning instructions. Cleaning the entire equipment should take no more than 15 minutes. It is important to note that this thorough cleaning process is generally not required on a daily basis, but rather every few months. SNOW+ is designed for easy disassembly, featuring a magnetic attachment system that simplifies the process. We suggest cleaning the litter box every two months when using clay clumping litter. For silica gel and crystal litter, it is recommended to clean the litter box on a monthly basis.

settings.h3: What is the difference between a new SNOW⁺ and a reconditioned SNOW⁺? *(二手未售时不放）
settings.text: Reconditioned SNOW⁺ units are typically SNOW⁺ units that were originally sold as new and then returned during our 30-day in-home trial. These units are carefully reconditioned and tested to ensure they meet the original factory specifications. PetSnowy stands behind reconditioned SNOW⁺ units with the same 30-day in-home trial and a 1-Year Warranty. Opting for a reconditioned SNOW⁺ can offer excellent value as you receive a manufacturer-approved product at a reduced price. However, it's essential to note that reconditioned units are technically used products. While we thoroughly clean them before shipping, there may be minor cosmetic imperfections or signs of previous use. If you have concerns about these factors, we recommend considering a new SNOW⁺ instead.

settings.h3: Where can I purchase?
settings.text: SNOW⁺ and all its accessories are available for purchase on petsnowy.com. If you have any questions about alternative purchasing options, please don't hesitate to reach out to info@petsnowy.com for more details.

settings.h3: What countries do you ship to?
settings.text: The SNOW+ is currently available in the following countries:  United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Belgium, France, Italy, Netherlands, Austria, Poland, Portugal, Sweden, Slovenia, Spain, Czech Republic, Hungary, Denmark, Ireland, Finland, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Monaco, Bulgaria, Estonia, Greece, Croatia, Latvia, Romania, Germany, Switzerland, and Slovakia. If your country is not included in this list, please contact us(超链接到联系我们页面） to inquire about its eligibility for shipping.

settings.h3: What methods of payment do you accept?
settings.text: We accept Visa, MasterCard, American Express, and PayPal. Additionally, we provide payment plan alternatives through Affirm. Please note that we do not accept checks or money orders as forms of payment.

settings.h3: How do I set up my SNOW⁺?
